poem:
The Art of the Cafetière  

In morning's quiet light,  
the cafetière sings,  
silver piston poised  
to plunge the dark heart,  
brewing warmth,  
in the deep dance of grounds.  

Awakened,  
steam whispers stories—  
the delicate sediments  
of dreams dissolve,  
as the cup holds the world,  
slowly,  
boldly.
